gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Snow and Ice Data Center
National Snow and Ice Data Center
NASA National Snow and Ice Data Center Distributed Active Archive Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The purpose of this site is to expose NASA satellite data and research on Arctic change in the form of maps that illustrate the changes taking place in the Arctic over time. A high-speed internet connection is recommended for map viewing. This site is presented with support from NASA Earth Sciences.

gmd:code.gco:CharacterString: AVHRR > Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: NASA EOS provides global passive microwave measurements of the Earth

The DMSP mission is to provide global visible and infrared cloud data and other specialized meteorological, oceanographic and solar-geophysical data in support of world wide Department of Defense (DoD) operations

The Nimbus-7 spacecraft was the last in a series of operational weather satellites operated by the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and the US National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

gmd:code.gco:CharacterString: NOAA-N > National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - N

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA-N is a polar-orbiting satellite developed by NASA for NOAA. NOAA-N collects information about Earth's atmosphere and environment to improve weather prediction and climate research across the globe. NOAA-N is in its 5th series of polar-orbiting satellites dating back to 1978 implementing the POES programme.
